clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Air Pollution on the Autonomic Nervous System Activity and the Presence of Sleep Apnea in Older Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Air Pollution on the Autonomic Nervous System Activity and the Presence of Sleep Apnea in Older Subjects: Longitudinal Multicentric Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

brief_summary.textblock: Impact of air pollution on the autonomic nervous system activity and presence of sleep apnea in older subjects.

detailed_description.textblock: The relation between the air pollution and morbidity, cardiovascular mortality was increasing interest. Analyses show an increase of respiratory difficulty, but also cardiac deaths in the daytime when the atmospheric pollution was increased. It was demonstrated that health effects of ambient air pollution in subjects presenting cardiac or lung difficulty were important. Mechanisms show a possible relation to autonomic nervous system (ANS) deactivation and mortality. Particularly, the ageing and ANS reach would be more predictive of cardiovascular events. Thus, we suggest estimating in 60 healthy volunteers from 60 to 80 years old, the impact of the air pollution on the autonomic nervous system activity and sleep apnea consequences.

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency analysis of heart rate variability
primary_outcome.time_frame: inclusion, 1 test night and 2 experimental nights

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of sleep, diurnal somnolence, sleep latency and PRS impact on the life quality.
Hour index quantification of night respiratory events.
Hour index quantification of autonomic awakening during the sleep.

arm_group.description: The subjects will have to live in districts where important atmospheric pollution is established

intervention.intervention_name: Air pollution study on healthy volunteers.
intervention.description: The subjects are examined three times: First the volunteers get used to equipments. Second and third the volunteers sleep in a pollution or purified air.

study_pop.textblock: The subjects will have to live in districts where important atmospheric pollution is established

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- reside in Lyon and Saint-Etienne cities
- security social affiliated or beneficiary
- information note signed
Exclusion Criteria:
- heart rate disorders
- pacemaker
- tabacco addiction or second-hand smoke
- morbid obesity (BMI > 30)
- insulin-dependent diabetes
- chronic disease on treatment
- antiarrythmic treatments
